definition: to recruit soldiers
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff

sentences.english: And many employers apparently don't think it is time yet.
sentences.chinese: 很多僱主似乎都認爲現在還沒到招兵買馬的時候。

sentences.english: Huang association army with silver and food do bait aggressively recruiting.
sentences.chinese: 皇協軍以銀元和食物做誘餌大肆招兵。

sentences.english: Terrorists use the Internet to recruit operatives and plot attacks.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子利用互聯網招兵買馬和策劃攻擊事件。

sentences.english: They didn't admit they were defeated; they began to recruit and attempted to stage a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 他們不承認失敗，他們開始招兵妄圖東山再起。

sentences.english: Confident German firms are now investing and hiring more freely.
sentences.chinese: 滿懷信心的德國公司現在更加自如地招兵買馬。

sentences.english: Although drafted, I finished the school year.
sentences.chinese: 因爲招兵，我完成了學業。

sentences.english: Mr. Yan is constantly adding factories and employees in China.
sentences.chinese: 嚴兆強還在中國不斷開設新廠，招兵買馬。

sentences.english: I hear those Ivy League Colleges are tough to get into.
sentences.chinese: 招兵人員現在甚至在名牌大學也受到歡迎。

sentences.english: Troops to school recruiting, fine sister, lily but was rejected.
sentences.chinese: 部隊來學校招兵，細妹入選，莉莉卻落選。

able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
soldiers/troops

refugee
